subject: Re: [junit] java.lang.ClassNotFoundException + junit
msgSnippet: You have defined ... but in your classpath you are using  do you want to call /Java/JUNIT/junit.jar junit.dir or
messageBody:
You have defined
> <property name="junit.dir"
> value="/Java/JUNIT/junit.jar"/>

but in your classpath you are using
<pathelement location="${junit.jar}" />


do you want to call /Java/JUNIT/junit.jar "junit.dir"
or "junit.jar"? The names need to be consistant.

--- chtifred1978 <chtifred1978@...> wrote:

>
>
> Hi,
> I'm trying to use Junit but i encounter an error :
> java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
>
> Here is my code :
> <project name="JUNIT" default="Test-junit"
> basedir=".">
>
> <property name="src.test.dir"
> value="extract/WEB-INF/src/test"/>
> <property name="build.dir" value="classes"/>
> <property name="junit.dir"
> value="/Java/JUNIT/junit.jar"/>
> <property name="report.dir" value="report"/>
> <property name="junit.out.dir.xml"
> value="${report.dir}/junit/xml"/>
>
> <property name="junit.jar" location="C:/Program
> Files/apache-ant-
> 1.6.2/lib/junit.jar"/>
>
> <path id="classpath">
> <pathelement location="${build.dir}" />
> <pathelement location="${junit.jar}" />
> </path>
>
> <target name="init">
> <delete dir="${junit.out.dir.xml}"/>
> <mkdir dir="${junit.out.dir.xml}"/>
> </target>
>
> <target name="Test-junit" depends="init"
> description="unit test" >
> <junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="no">
> <formatter type="xml" />
> <classpath refid="classpath"/>
> <batchtest fork="yes"
> todir="${junit.out.dir.xml}">
> <fileset dir="${src.test.dir}"
> includes="**/*Test.java"/>
> </batchtest>
> </junit>
> </target>
> </project>
>
> Someone can help me to resolve the problem ?
>
> Thanks in advance
>
> Fred
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
